snippet.title: Review: 'Hearthstone' card game is the real deal
snippet.description: Video game publishers don't take many risks with their most popular franchises.

snippet.title: Wonkbook: The FCC is trying to thread the needle on net neutrality
snippet.description: A look at the FCC's middle-ground attempt on net neutrality

snippet.title: Wacha too wild in wind, Cardinals lose to Mets 3-2
snippet.description: Michael Wacha was too wild in the wind and Matt Carpenter got tagged out at the plate.

snippet.title: Mets cut down tying run, hold off Cardinals 3-2
snippet.description: With a 360-foot relay in the ninth inning, the New York Mets prevented a hard-fought victory from vanishing in the wind.

snippet.title: Pineda says he'll learn from ejection for pine tar
snippet.description: The pine tar glistened on Michael Pineda's neck, improving his grip and inviting trouble.

snippet.title: Red Sox beat Yanks 5-1 after getting Pineda tossed
snippet.description: The Boston Red Sox made sure the umpires noticed something on New York pitcher Michael Pineda this time.

snippet.title: Pineda tossed for pine tar; Red Sox beat Yanks 5-1
snippet.description: The pine tar on Michael Pineda's neck was a stain for the New York Yankees.

snippet.title: NL Capsules
snippet.description: The Chicago Cubs marked Wrigley Field's 100th birthday in dramatic fashion Wednesday, allowing the Arizona Diamondbacks to rally for five runs in the ninth inning and a 7-5 victory.

snippet.title: Yanks pitcher Pineda ejected for substance on neck
snippet.description: Less than two weeks after pitching against Boston with what appeared to be pine tar on his pitching hand, the New York Yankees' Michael Pineda was ejected from a game against the Red Sox on Wednesday night after umpires found a foreign substance on his neck.

snippet.title: AP News in Brief at 10:58 p.m. EDT
snippet.description: Syrian activists, medics accuse Assad government of chlorine gas attacks; Syria denies it
